page.title: 09THE COUNTRYSIDE AROUND
page.content: Midmar is a hilly place with lots of woodland.There are many fields planted in them are crops such as neeps (turnips), potatoes, corn, barley, oil seed rape and peas.Farmers look after their crops and shoot the pests which destroy them.There is lots of shooting in Midmar including rabbits, deer, pheasant, grouse, pigeons, crows and even clay pigeons.Trees include many Scots pine, beech and some silver birch.There are lots of animals in Midmar such as foxes, stoats, weasels, minks, rats, mice, voles, moles and hedgehogs.There are also some wild cats.My brother shot one and had it stuffed.There is a lot of birdlife in Midmar.We often see wild ducks, geese, capercaillies , magpies, woodpeckers, owls, kestrels and buzzards.Most of them feed in the fields and woods.
